title: Orson Welles Radio Theatre
description:
Orson Welles is arguably the greatest figure in the history of Twentieth Century film and radio. He revolutionized the Broadway stage at the Mercury Theatre, broadcasting, and film before this twenty-sixth birthday. This collection of WellesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ best radio shows from 1938 to 1952 will massage your soul as the dulcet tones of his mellifluous voice wash over your psyche and carry you back to a time before the Internet, before television, and before all the other modern convinces that we take for granted.

AIFF-C audio files.

Contents:

Bram Stoker - Dracula
Mutiny on the Bounty
Orson Welles Meets H.G. Wells
The Lux Radio Theatre - Break of Hearts
The Shadow - Hounds in the Hills
War of the Worlds
New York/A Tapestry for Radio
The Third Man
This is My Best - Diamond as Big as the Ritz
